lv.emes.libraries.tools

Class MS_StringTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.tools.MS_StringTools

  • public final class MS_StringTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Module designed to combine different actions related to text formatting and other things to do with String type Objects. Also there is included latvian laguage customization tools. Methods: -getRandomString -isSubstring -textContains -replaceInString -getInversedText -getTextWithCapitalizedFirstLetter -hasOnlyDigitsInText -hasOnlyASCIILettersInText -isCharASCIILetter -removeLV -textToWords -removePunctuation -getHashFromString -intToStr -strToInt -chr -ord -getSubstring
    Version:
    1.6.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MS_StringTools.TNotificationLang 
      static class  MS_StringTools.TSymbolTypeForGenerator
      Used to describe small letters, capital letters, digits and also symbols (stfgNormalSymbol :/*!@#$%^& etc.), and also special UTF-8 or Unicode symbols, for example, 1/4 symbol, degree symbol, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomString

        public static java.lang.String getRandomString(int aSymbolCount,
                                               java.util.Set<MS_StringTools.TSymbolTypeForGenerator> aOptions)
        Method implements generation of text of size aSymbolCount. Generated text will consist of symbols that are defined in set SetForCodeGenParams.
        Example:
        MSStringTools.SetForCodeGenParams.add(TSymbolTypeForGenerator.stfgSmallLetter);
        MSStringTools.SetForCodeGenParams.add(TSymbolTypeForGenerator.stfgDigit);
        String test = MSStringTools.RandomString(5, MSStringTools.SetForCodeGenParams);
        Note: there is no need to do MSStringTools.SetForCodeGenParams.clear(). Method will do it after successful generation.
        Parameters:
        aSymbolCount - count of generated symbols.
        aOptions - settings, which symbols will resulting text consist.
        Returns:
        text of random symbols: de24j
        See Also:
        MS_StringTools.TSymbolTypeForGenerator

      • getRandomString

        public static java.lang.String getRandomString(int aSymbolCount)
        Overloaded version with default option - return only random small letters.
        Parameters:
        aSymbolCount - length of result text.
        Returns:
        random string.

      • isSubstring

        public static boolean isSubstring(java.lang.String aSmallString,
                                  java.lang.String aBigString,
                                  boolean aCaseSensitive)
        Checks, whether text aSmallString is a part of some bigger text aBigString.
        Parameters:
        aBigString - text that will be tested.
        aSmallString - pattern to find in text.
        aCaseSensitive - true if checking will be done case sensitively.
        Returns:
        true if aText contains pattern, otherwise returns false.

      • isSubstring

        public static boolean isSubstring(java.lang.String aSmallString,
                                  java.lang.String aBigString)
        Checks, whether text aSmallString is a part of some bigger text aBigString.

        This function is case sensitive.

        Parameters:
        aBigString - text that will be tested.
        aSmallString - pattern to find in text.
        Returns:
        true if aBigString contains aSmallString, otherwise returns false.

        This function is case sensitive.

        pattern - pattern to find in text.
        Returns:
        true if aText contains pattern, otherwise returns false.

      • replaceInString

        public static java.lang.String replaceInString(java.lang.String aStr,
                                               java.lang.String aPattern,
                                               java.lang.String aReplaceWith,
                                               boolean aCaseSensitiveCheck)
        Replaces part aPattern of text aStr with string aReplaceWith.
        Parameters:
        aStr - [ABCDEFG]
        aPattern - [CD]
        aReplaceWith - [XY]
        aCaseSensitiveCheck - if true and text aStr is [ABcdEFG] then replacement will not be made.
        Returns:
        [ABXYEFG]

      • replaceInString

        public static java.lang.String replaceInString(java.lang.String aStr,
                                               java.lang.String aPattern,
                                               java.lang.String aReplaceWith)
        Always ignores case.
        Parameters:
        aStr - [ABCDEFG]
        aPattern - [CD]
        aReplaceWith - [XY]
        Returns:
        [ABXYEFG]

      • isCharASCIILetter

        public static boolean isCharASCIILetter(char aSymbol)
        Checks only for ASCII letter. Chars that aren't letters or are non ASCII letters (cyrillic and other language characters) are not accepted.
        Parameters:
        aSymbol - [a..z, A..Z][0..1, āčūī..., ~!@#$%^&*...]
        Returns:
        [true][false]

      • hasOnlyASCIILettersInText

        Parameters:
        aText - [abc][abc1]
        Returns:
        [true][false]
        See Also:
        isCharASCIILetter(char)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        "O, kads brinumins!"

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        aText - input text with punctuation.
        Returns:
        output text without punctuation.

      • getHashFromString

        public static java.lang.String getHashFromString(java.lang.String aTextForHashGen)
        From passed text generates text hashed with SHA1 algorithm using default salt value and default key length.
        Parameters:
        aTextForHashGen - a text which will be used to do hashing.
        Returns:
        empty string in case if aTextToHash is empty.
